newsitem.title: UK: Dixons shares firm, NatWest repeats "buy'.
newsitem.headline: Dixons shares firm, NatWest repeats "buy'.

text.p: Shares in Dixons were sharply higher on Friday as NatWest reiterated its positive stance on the stock, favouring it above others in the sector.
The shares were up 20-1/2p at 564-1/2p in volume of nearly 3 million shares by 1029 GMT. Dealers said there was also talk of switching in the sector.

Other share movers in the sector were Argos Plc up 11p at 762p and Marks & Spencer which rose 10p to 515p. Traders said investors could be chosing to switch out of Kingfisher Plc which was down 3-1/2p at 639-1/2p.
A generally more buoyant retail sector was also helped by the CBI's latest Distributive Trades survey released today.
Retail sales continued to grow in September but at a slower pace than August, the CBI said.
The sharp downturn in stock levels, to an all-time low, contrasted with the sharp build-up in August, the survey said.
